feed.title: Aaron Schlegel's Notebook of Interesting Things - SQL

entry.title: Analyzing the Consumer Complaints Database with Python, SQL and Plotly
entry.summary: The consumer complaints database is a collection of complaints received by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection related to financial products and services. This post explores creating a database file using SQLite and analyzing the data with Pandas and Plotly.

.CodeMirror {

}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}

}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;

  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;

  display: box;

}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;

}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;

div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;

  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;

div.output_area

}

.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;

div.output_area pre {

  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;

  vertical-align: baseline;

  background-color: transparent;

/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {

}
pre.raw_input_prompt {

}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}

.highlight .il { color: #666666 } /* Literal.Number.Integer.Long */</style><div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <a href="http://catalog.data.gov/dataset/consumer-complaint-database#topic=consumer_navigation">consumer complaints database</a> provided by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, can be downloaded as a 190mb csv file.</p>
<p>Although the csv file is not large relative to other available datasets that can exceed many gigabytes in size, it still provides good motivation for aggregating the data using SQL and outputting into a Pandas DataFrame. This can all be done conveniently with Pandas's <a href="http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/io.html">iotools</a>.</p>
<p>This post will explore creating a database file with the Consumer Complaints database and analyzing the data with <a href="http://pandas.pydata.org/">Pandas</a> and <a href="https://plot.ly/">Plotly</a>. I was inspired to use SQL and Plotly in conjunction by this <a href="https://plot.ly/python/big-data-analytics-with-pandas-and-sqlite/">blog post that examines one of the NYC Open Data Portal</a>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">display</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">sqlite3</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">sqlalchemy</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">create_engine</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">string</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">statsmodels.stats.multicomp</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">pairwise_tukeyhsd</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">scipy</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">stats</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">plotly.plotly</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">py</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">plotly.tools</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">FigureFactory</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">FF</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">plotly.graph_objs</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Bar</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Scatter</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Marker</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Layout</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Choropleth</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Histogram</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Before creating a new database file, the Consumer Complaints csv file can be inspected to get a quick view of what is included.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'raw/Consumer_Complaints.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nrows</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">

</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Building-the-Database">Building the Database<a class="anchor-link" href="#Building-the-Database">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Create the database connection using <a href="http://www.sqlalchemy.org/">sqlalchemy</a> <code>create_engine</code> method.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">db_conn</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">create_engine</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'sqlite:///databases/complaints.db'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The amount of rows in the csv to process on each iteration</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">chunks</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">25000</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The csv data is processed and appended to the database created above. As each chunk is processed, the data columns are formatted to remove whitespace and make each word proper case.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">data</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'raw/Consumer_Complaints.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">chunksize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">chunks</span><span class="p">,</span>
                       <span class="n">iterator</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">encoding</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'utf-8'</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="n">col</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">col</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">col</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">})</span>
    <span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="n">col</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">col</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strip</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">col</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">})</span>
    <span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="n">col</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">string</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">capwords</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">col</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">col</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">})</span>
    <span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="n">col</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">col</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">col</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">})</span>
    
    <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_sql</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'data'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">if_exists</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'append'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To confirm the data was processed and appended to the database correctly, a quick query can be ran to display the first 10 rows of the database.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SELECT * FROM data LIMIT 10'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>With the data processed into a database file, we can begin analyzing the data.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Which Product has the most complaints?</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">query</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SELECT Product, Company, COUNT(*) as `Complaints`'</span>
                         <span class="s1">'FROM data '</span>
                         <span class="s1">'GROUP BY Product '</span>
                         <span class="s1">'ORDER BY `Complaints` DESC'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">Bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">query</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Product</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">query</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Complaints</span><span class="p">)],</span> <span class="n">filename</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'ConsumerComplaints_Products with most complaints'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[9]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<iframe id="igraph" scrolling="no" style="border:none;" seamless="seamless" src="https://plot.ly/~aaronsc32/293.embed" height="525px" width="100%"></iframe>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Credit and debt related products have the most complaints, starting with Mortgages.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Which Companies have the Most Complaints?</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">query_responses</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SELECT Company, COUNT(*) as `Complaints` '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'FROM data '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'GROUP BY Company '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'ORDER BY `Complaints` DESC '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'LIMIT 10 '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">Bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">query_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Company</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">query_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Complaints</span><span class="p">)],</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'ConsumerComplaints_Companies with most Complaints'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[11]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<iframe id="igraph" scrolling="no" style="border:none;" seamless="seamless" src="https://plot.ly/~aaronsc32/295.embed" height="525px" width="100%"></iframe>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The largest financial firms including Bank of America, Wells Fargo and J.P. Morgan are near the top, which could be due simply to the size of the firms relative to others.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Using SQL queries and Pandas makes reshaping and aggregating data much more straightforward. For example, with SQL and Pandas, we can quickly pull the relevant data from the database and create a ratio from the metrics to find which companies have the lowest timely response ratios.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">query_comp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SELECT Company, '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'COUNT(CASE WHEN `TimelyResponse?` = "Yes" THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) As YesCount, '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'COUNT(CASE WHEN `TimelyResponse?` = "No" THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) As NoCount, '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'COUNT(*) as Total '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'FROM data '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'GROUP BY Company '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'HAVING COUNT(*) > 500 '</span>
                           <span class="s1">'ORDER BY YesCount DESC'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">query_comp</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Timely_Response_Ratio'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">query_comp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">YesCount</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">query_comp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Total</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">100</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">bot_10_response</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">query_comp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Timely_Response_Ratio'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ascending</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">responses</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Timely Responses: '</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">bot_10_response</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">YesCount</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s1">'<br>'</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s1">'Untimely Responses: '</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">bot_10_response</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">NoCount</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">Bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">bot_10_response</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Company</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">bot_10_response</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Timely_Response_Ratio</span><span class="p">,</span> 
              <span class="n">text</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">responses</span><span class="p">)],</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'ConsumerComplaints_LowestTimelyResponse'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[16]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<iframe id="igraph" scrolling="no" style="border:none;" seamless="seamless" src="https://plot.ly/~aaronsc32/297.embed" height="525px" width="100%"></iframe>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note none of the firms with the most complaints are included here.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It was seen earlier that mortgages related issues have the most complaints. Which issues are specifically complained about the most?</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">query3</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SELECT Product, Issue, COUNT(*) `Number of Complaints` '</span>
                          <span class="s1">'FROM data '</span>
                          <span class="s1">'WHERE Product = "Mortgage" '</span>
                          <span class="s1">'GROUP BY Issue '</span>
                          <span class="s1">'ORDER BY `Number of Complaints` DESC'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">Bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">query3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Issue</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">query3</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Number of Complaints'</span><span class="p">])],</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'ConsumerComplaints_MostComplainedProductIssue'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[18]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<iframe id="igraph" scrolling="no" style="border:none;" seamless="seamless" src="https://plot.ly/~aaronsc32/299.embed" height="525px" width="100%"></iframe>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The majority of mortgage complaints are related to loan modification, collection, services, payments and other related issues.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Choropleth maps can be plotted using Plotly. These maps can display which states have the most complaints.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">state_query</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SELECT State, Product, COUNT(*) as `Complaints` '</span>
                                <span class="s1">'FROM data '</span>
                                <span class="s1">'WHERE State <> "None" '</span>
                                <span class="s1">'GROUP BY State'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span>
                               <span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As one would expect, the more populated states such as California, Texas, Florida and New York have the most complaints.</p>
<p>Is there a particular pattern to which companies receive the most complaints by state? Would one expect the company with the most complaints be contained more to regions in which the firm has a large presence (Bank of America on the East Coast, J.P. Morgan in the Northeast, etc.)?</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">query_comps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SELECT State, Company, COUNT(*) as `Complaints` '</span>
                               <span class="s1">'FROM data '</span>
                               <span class="s1">'WHERE State <> "None" '</span>
                               <span class="s1">'AND Company <> "None" '</span>
                               <span class="s1">'GROUP BY Company, State '</span>
                               <span class="s1">'ORDER BY `Complaints` DESC, Company, State'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">state_grouped</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">query_comps</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'State'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">as_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">first</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Complaints'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ascending</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">state_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Company_Code'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">state_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Company'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'category'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">codes</span>
<span class="n">company_codes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">state_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Company'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">state_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Company_Code'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Code'</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dat</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="nb">type</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'choropleth'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">locations</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">state_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'State'</span><span class="p">],</span>
    <span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">=</span>  <span class="n">state_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Company_Code'</span><span class="p">],</span>
    <span class="n">locationmode</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'USA-states'</span><span class="p">,</span>

            <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(128,177,211)'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(253,180,98)'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(179,222,105)'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(252,205,229)'</span><span class="p">],</span>\
            <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(217,217,217)'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.9</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(188,128,189)'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(204,235,197)'</span><span class="p">]],</span>
    <span class="n">colorbar</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">tickmode</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'array'</span><span class="p">,</span>

        <span class="n">ticktext</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">company_codes</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Code</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="p">)]</span>

<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">geo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">scope</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'usa'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">showlakes</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">lakecolor</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255, 255, 255)'</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">dat</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">layout</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'ConsumerComplaints_MostComplainedCompanyByState'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The choropleth map shows Bank of America receives the most complaints throughout the United States while Wells Fargo is generally centered around the Mid and Central US. Interestingly, Equifax receives the most complaints in many Southeastern states.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">

</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">

                               <span class="s1">'FROM data '</span>
                               <span class="s1">'WHERE State <> "None" '</span>
                               <span class="s1">'AND Product <> "None" '</span>
                               <span class="s1">'GROUP BY Product, State '</span>
                               <span class="s1">'ORDER BY `Complaints` DESC, Product, State'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">product_grouped</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">query_products</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'State'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">as_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">first</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Complaints'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ascending</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">product_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Product_Code'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">product_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Product'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'category'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">codes</span>
<span class="n">product_codes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">product_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Product'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">product_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Product_Code'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Code'</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dat</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="nb">type</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'choropleth'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">locations</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">product_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'State'</span><span class="p">],</span>
    <span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">=</span>  <span class="n">product_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Product_Code'</span><span class="p">],</span>
    <span class="n">locationmode</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'USA-states'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">text</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">product_grouped</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Product'</span><span class="p">],</span>
    <span class="n">colorscale</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[[</span><span class="mf">0.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,255,179)'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.25</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(141,211,199)'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.50</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(190,186,218)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.75</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(251,128,114)'</span><span class="p">],</span>\
            <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(128,177,211)'</span><span class="p">]],</span>
    <span class="n">colorbar</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">tickmode</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'array'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">tickvals</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">product_codes</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="n">ticktext</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">product_codes</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Code</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="p">)]</span>

<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Mortgage related issues receive the most complaints by far across the United States. Interestingly enough, debt collection and credit reporting are the most complained about in the central United States.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The dataset contains tags that detail if the consumer is elderly and/or a servicemember. Using this data, we can test if having a particular tag results in a slower or faster response time using the <a href="http://statsmodels.sourceforge.net/">statsmodels</a> package.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">tag_responses</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SELECT Company, Tags, `TimelyResponse?`, '</span>
                 <span class="s1">'COUNT(CASE WHEN `TimelyResponse?` = "Yes" THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) As YesCount, '</span>
                 <span class="s1">'COUNT(CASE WHEN `TimelyResponse?` = "No" THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) As NoCount, '</span>
                 <span class="s1">'COUNT(*) as Total '</span>
                 <span class="s1">'FROM data '</span>
                 <span class="s1">'GROUP BY Company '</span>
                 <span class="s1">'ORDER BY YesCount DESC'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">db_conn</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'TimelyResponse?'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'TimelyResponse'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Tags</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">where</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Tags</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'No Tag'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Tags</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Timely_Response_Ratio'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">YesCount</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Total</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">100</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pivoted</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pivot_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'TimelyResponse'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Company'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Tags'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">values</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Timely_Response_Ratio'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Using the kruskal-wallis implementation in the statsmodel package, it can be tested if there is a significant difference in response time ratio by designated tag.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">stats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mstats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">kruskalwallis</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pivoted</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Timely_Response_Ratio</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'No Tag'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">pivoted</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Timely_Response_Ratio</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Older American'</span><span class="p">],</span> 
                          <span class="n">pivoted</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Timely_Response_Ratio</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Older American, Servicemember'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">pivoted</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Timely_Response_Ratio</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Servicemember'</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[29]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>KruskalResult(statistic=0.34332534569847822, pvalue=0.95168441327165698)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The p-value is way above 0.05 and therefore it can be concluded there is no significant difference in response time. Each tag can also be compared individually using Tukey's test.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span> <span class="n">pairwise_tukeyhsd</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Timely_Response_Ratio</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tag_responses</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Tags</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>                     Multiple Comparison of Means - Tukey HSD,FWER=0.05                     
============================================================================================
            group1                        group2            meandiff  lower    upper  reject
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
            No Tag                    Older American         0.6005  -5.4108   6.6118 False 
            No Tag            Older American, Servicemember -0.1383  -12.7571 12.4805 False 
            No Tag                    Servicemember          1.9458  -3.8194   7.711  False 
        Older American        Older American, Servicemember -0.7388  -14.5275 13.0499 False 
        Older American                Servicemember          1.3453  -6.6628   9.3534 False 
Older American, Servicemember         Servicemember          2.0841  -11.5991 15.7673 False 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Tukey's test reports there are no significant differences between each group.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Summary">Summary<a class="anchor-link" href="#Summary">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In this notebook, using SQL and Pandas to analyze larger sets of data was explored with visualizations from the Plotly library. Pandas provides many tools to allow smoother workflows with large data sets and SQL. Python is also a good tool for working with databases, especially with packages such as SQLAlchemy.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
